title: At the caribou crossing place. Pt. 2
creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Education Development Center, Quentin Brown and Kevin Smith
brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. In this part, two men join the four people at camp. The men build a row of inukshuit, manlike figures which they use to deflect the oncoming caribou into the water, where they are subsequently speared and floated ashore. A great feast follows.
